Description: Fragment of a pottery black-figured amphora or olpe. Clay: yellow-red with mica. Exterior: head of a panther to right; to right, part of floral complex including pendent palmette with chevron-incised band. Inside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Production centre uncertain in view of the mention of mica in the clay by Prins de Jong in her notebook.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 62, no. 20)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0922)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2954 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
Miscellaneous number: VII.20 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
